Package: org.jlab.analysis

[Groovy] Class Analysis

    • org.jlab.analysis.Analysis 
    • @groovy.transform.CompileStatic
class Analysis
extends java.lang.Object

      Encapsulates some common analysis procedures. If you are doing a more customized/less general analysis you will probably want to use the addVars() methods.

      Version:
      1.0
      Authors:
      Matthew McEneaney

          Constructor stub with defaults for processing MC::Lund event (just pass empty list to decay parameter or if you want to use a combo MC/REC event reset the decay for the kinematics object).

        • protected void processComboEvents(HipoReader reader)

          Loop through events and run analysis using combination of MC::Lund and REC::Particle particles. You may want to override and customize this method. Make sure you exactly mirror the order of variables in your NTuple when adding to the data array.

          Parameters:
          reader

        • protected void processEvents(HipoReader reader)

          Loop through events and run analysis. You may want to override and customize this method. Make sure you exactly mirror the order of variables in your NTuple when adding to the data array.

          Parameters:
          reader

        • protected void processMatchEvents(HipoReader reader)

          Loop through events and run analysis looking for matching decays of MC::Lund and REC::Particle particles. You may want to override and customize this method. Make sure you exactly mirror the order of variables in your NTuple when adding to the data array.

          Parameters:
          reader

        • protected void setTargetPID(int pid)

          Set target lund pid in constants and propagate changes to kinematics.

          Parameters:
          pid

        • protected void setTreeName(java.lang.String treeName)

          Set tree name for output TNTuple.

          Parameters:
          treeName

        • protected void setTupleNames()

          Sets the tuple variable names. Make sure ordering is the same in the array used to add data to the tuple.

        • protected void setUseMC(boolean useMC)

          Set boolean for using MC::Lund bank instead of REC::Particle. Also applies for beam for kinematics when using combo event.

          Parameters:
          MC

        • protected void splitOutFile(int num)

          Creates new outfiles with successively numbered names, splitting on number of data events added to output or event/run number (TODO), modifiable via command line argument.

          Parameters:
          num

        • protected void write2Root()

          Write TNTuple to ROOT files and close.

          throws:
          InterruptedException
